subject: Entrepreneurship
title: The Build-Measure-Learn Loop
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Build-Measure-Learn Loop.

hook.text: Most startups build, launch, and pray. The lean startup replaces prayer with a feedback loop.

buildup.text: The loop has three steps: build a product, measure how customers behave, learn what to do next.

discovery.text: The secret is speed. The faster you complete the loop, the faster you learn, the less money you burn.

twist.text: But here's the trick: you plan the loop in reverse. Start with what you need to learn, then build.

climax.text: Dropbox ran the loop in two weeks instead of six monthsâ€”and saved millions in wasted engineering.

punchline.text: The startup that learns fastest wins.
